inputs.name: build_path
inputs.description: Path to build artifact(s) - jar or class files in this directory will be uploaded for review

inputs.name: destination_commit
inputs.description: SHA of next commit to be committed to source code repository after an event

inputs.name: source_commit
inputs.description: SHA of previous commit in the source code repository existed before an event

inputs.name: merge_base_commit
inputs.description: SHA of a commit thats the merge base for before and after commits in a pull or merge request

inputs.name: kms_key_id
inputs.description: AWS KMS Key ID to use for encrypting source code/build artifacts. By default, Amazon-owned encryption key is used. Supplying this value overrides it to use Customer-owned encryption key

inputs.name: author
inputs.description: Author/Actor who triggered an event in the source code repository

inputs.name: event_id
inputs.description: An identifier for the event that triggered CodeGuru Reviewer Analysis, e.g. Pull or Merge request id

inputs.name: event_name
inputs.description: Name of the event that triggered the CI/CD workflow [supported Events: push, pull, merge_request_event, schedule, workflow_dispatch]

inputs.name: event_state
inputs.description: State of the event that triggered the CI/CD workflow [example: pull_request: "opened"]

inputs.name: client_id
inputs.description: Unique identifier referring to a specific client version

inputs.name: s3_bucket
inputs.description: S3 Bucket which will be used for code reviews

inputs.name: vendor_name
inputs.description: Vendor Name(e.g. GITHUB, GITLAB) for CI/CD.

inputs.name: output_format
inputs.description: Expected format for the results (e.g SARIF, SAST, JENKINS)

evidence.reasoning: The CodeGuru Reviewer Action is focused on analyzing code quality through reviews, which directly falls under the Code quality category. It also involves testing aspects by reviewing the code for potential issues.
